title: FULL SHOW: Erdogan summons US ambassador after Armenia vote
text: Turkey has summoned its US ambassador after lawmakers in Washington voted to recognize the Ottoman-era mass killings of Armenians as a genocide. This prompted a strong response from Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. RT America's Faran Fronczak reports. Then Aram Suren Hamparian, executive director of the Armenian National Committee of America, weighs in. Meanwhile, have months of protests forced Hong Kong into a recession? “Boom Bust” co-host Christy Ai breaks it down. Plus, homeless veterans in Canada are getting a fresh start with tiny houses. RT America's Alex Mihailovich reports from Toronto.
